text: Was unable to help me or give me a quote. Interior and exterior was looked at and I was hopeful. Even if insurance didn't cover it, we knew it had to be repaired. The person that did the initial visit was professional. Disappointed I could not get help with the matter or receive a quote. If they could not fix or repair it, a referral would have been nice.

resp.text: I inspected the roof damage and interior water damage on the fireplace wall for Mr. Echols.  Mr. Echols also had me look at the back side of the house where there was rotten siding that covered the entire rear elevation. I had my roofer go by and do an inspection on the roof and he identified that the existing top layer of roofing also had a roll roof installed under the top layer of roofing indicating that a repair has been attempted in the past already on this issue and considering the complexity of the repair and how extensive it would be to repair the water leak completely and with a warranty,  I then contacted Mr. Echols with the information. Mr. Echols informed me that replacing the entire front slope (which is what was required in order to perform this task correctly where a warranty could come with the work) he informed me that it would be to much for him to do. I informed Mr. Echols that a simple repair could not be done and also explained to him that Landmark does not like to get into performing repairs behind other trades that had already failed the first time. Mr. Echols then said that he would go elsewhere for another Estimate. -David

text: Very upset with this place. with repairs on roof. 2 different times. My insurance referred them and now were having to pay for it now. They might be good with other things but roofing is a negative.I was told after fixing a area that leaked again and charged that they have to make some money. We learned our lesson the hard way.

name: Jess Palmer
text:
This company takes the phrase "cutting corners" to new, literal levels. If you get nothing else from my review, get this: use anyone but Landmark.

This company dragged my relatively small project on for months. The employees are nice enough, but are unbelievably slow and inept. More than once, I had to call the main office to "tattle" on Ben, the project manager, who had gone totally AWOL and would not communicate despite my house being in complete disarray thanks to his project management.

Installing quarter round proved too difficult for this company. They had to come out over 4 separate times to complete this job. They literally skipped parts of the wall because there was furniture or a floor mat in front of it. They skipped the kitchen entirely. And when they did return to install it there, they literally just left giant gaps in each corner without joining the pieces together. They were dumbfounded that I wanted the quarter round to join at the corners. WTF!

They destroyed 2 toilet lids by putting tools on them.  They re-seated toilets crooked and rocking and leaking.  They left the closet bolts uncovered and did a caulking job you'd expect from a toddler.

There are places in the laminate floor with visible gaps between planks. There were gouges in it that they filled with wood filler and called it a day. They did a sloppy paint job in both bathrooms (at least they got the color right, though).

It was unbelievable how many times these people had to come back to my house to fix their screw-ups and even now, a year later, I'm still finding fresh, mind-boggling issues.

If you care about your house at all, use someone else.

I would like to add that the owner of the company did reach out to me within 24 hours of my review with apologies and an offer to make it right. I declined, however, on the basis that I have no faith in them being capable of doing any of this job.

resp.text:
Thank you for taking the time to communicate to us why our service did not meet your expectations. Please accept our sincerest apologies for any trouble or inconvenience we have caused you. We have every desire to address your needs and provide the best solution available to resolve your issues as soon as possible. Unfortunately, during our phone conversation on May 30, 2019, you informed us that you would not allow us the opportunity to resolve your issues.
In the event that you allow us to make matters right, please contact us at our office number (901-452-0390).

name: Lauren Russell
text: The Landmark Water mitigation crew saved us this week! Following a sizable water leak, the ceiling in our living room collapsed. They worked efficiently, moving our furniture and cleaning up the mountains of insulation. Jacob (the team leader) and the rest of his crew was top notch. They were kind and so easy to work with. In the following days, as Jacob monitored the drying, when he said he would be at my house at a certain time—- he showed up right when he promised. No four hour window of waiting which was so nice! The communication was above expectation and these guys made a less than desirable situation tolerable. I’m so thankful for Landmark, the water mitigation crew, our contractor, and Jacob!

We have been lied to about when it will be completed. We have been told that their guy is just doing what we have specified ( which is NOT true). And now, after waiting months and loosing revenue from rentals, their guy came back after 930pm and remudded the walls and ceilings that had just been painted(because he said that is what we wanted! which is NOT true!!) The rooms had just been cleaned and to boot it is horrible work. We have hired someone new to finish what they couldn't get done. DO NOT HIRE THIS COMPANY! The person they use for remodel work does NOT know what he is doing and sadly, the owners are standing behind him and his lies.

name: Cameron Galbreath
text: Do not use this company. They cut corners and just want checks signed whether it's done correctly or not. There was a problem (that I personally noticed and pointed out and it was never brought to my attention by the contractor). It could have been easily fixed during the repair process but was not addressed and work that was completed now has to be undone to fix this. In addition, they have acted like this is a total inconvenience for them when they failed to notice the issue (or ignored it) in the first place. Use any other company but this one. They billed for several services they did not provide  It took over 3 weeks for anyone to even come out and evaluate/fix the issue after it was pointed out to them (they already had all of their large checks signed at this point).  And their "fix"was more like a bandaid and try and tell my wife there wont be any issues with it. Slow response times. Poor customer service. Their "customer service" team that is supposed to regular check in with you called 1 time at the beginning of the job and never heard from them again. This job was a 2-3 week job and is now on month 3. If you want repairs done timely and properly look elsewhere.

text: Let me start at the start of my process. I explain to them what the job was going to intel. But yet for some reason they were not listening. When they did come out, I was told that x y and z would be complete that day by the project manager, will only x was explained to the crew that came out and they were tasked with other jobs so they could not finish when I asked why they were not completing that days work. I was never provided samples and they wanted to charge me more for what I wanted because I had to go out and look for my own flooring, never provide with vanity or tub style before they installed them, and they claimed they did more work to the insurance company then the actual done, I fired them and finished the job for them.

Too many issues to list. TERRIBLE project management and I would NEVER pay them on my own. I'm firing my insurance company (USAA) over this debacle.

Please find another restoration company if your insurance provider recommends these people, then find another insurance provider.

name: TR
text:
APEX started our bathroom in May 2016. They said they would be done i n 7 to 10 days. As of July 20th they still had not finished. We had a vacation planned and upon our return, the unprofessional work ethic and attitude continued so we fired them.
The problems:
They have installed the tile flooring incorrectly, it is very uneven, has to be removed and replaced. The tile was uneven, grout lines not the same and tile was crooked. They chipped floor tile trying to fix the mistakes they made.
They rebuilt the shower walls but made the shower to large. The cabinets now do fit in place. The shower walls have to removed as does the mud bed for the shower.
The tile work they did on the shower had to removed because they had a 1 inch bow i n the wall. The bow in the wall was due to APEX's contractors putting inch of thin set or mortar behind the tile, inch thick!
The floor pan was not sealed or glued correctly. This was pointed out to me two other contractors who have given us bids.
APEX also did not install the left counter properly so they cut the stone back splash and side splash to try to make it fit. They cut the back splash uneven.
They broke fixtures in the bathroom.
I had to make them put insulation back in the walls.
Apex did paint behind the counters in the bathroom.
Apex contractors would show up and work for a couple of hours and then leave to g to another job. At times they didn't even show up.
I was told not to worry about the job in progress but the end result. If your foundation on the job is not right the finished product will be junk!
APEX would lie to us about job finish date. They would tell us we will be done by this Friday, but the tile had not been ordered or was not going to in till the next week.
The contractors would sit out back and smoke under my Gazebo! One of the guys had his girl friend hanging out all day. They did fire him after I brought this up.
I had to tell them to not smoke under my Gazebo, don't put your stuff on my grill, do not smoke on my porch, do not turn on my outside fans and for them to clean up after themselves.

I love my new kitchen,  and flooring in the great room and dining room. the site manager was outstanding, he checked with me every day to make sure I was satisfied. text: DENNIS MAYNOR and the remediation crew were great on both of my claims. professional and quick with the work. I wish he would have been the project manager on my rebuild. I had to fix AC vents myself that said project manager had told contractors to fix as I told them not to take down. they taped around them and when they took tape off. they ripped em out... they had no knowledge of it to fix them and were not told.. They damaged my drawer in my kitchen and tried to blame me for it. Broke my kitchen faucet as they should have taken the faucet from the sink.. Instead I find my sink on the floor all willy nilly . On the paint process they puled nails and picture hooks and patched but on other areas they just painted over the pic hooks and so forth. They also painted without using drop cloths on my wood floors and set a paint tray on my wood floor without a drop cloth under it. and I will have to pay someone to pressure wash my front sidewalk as they got paint spatters everywhere when they were cutting and working outside.. They did fix the items in question, drawer faucet and cabinets. but project manager said we will go thru this during the walk thru.. To me it would make sense to take care of this BEFORE THE walk thru.. I am visually impaired and I am glad I had friends to point out stuff they needed to fix.. They got it all fixed but it should have never come to that had the project manager been on the ball. Y'all need to put me on the payroll for this job. and he charged me for a Dump truck that did not get used for hauling away debris.. This was a rebuild no debris to haul away. He got snappy and angry.. "I am not taking that truck charge off"  and took it personally when I questioned the Dump truck charge. I am not trying to nickel and dime anyone I just expect things to be as they were before it happened. Said project manager was very aloof and uncaring or understanding. I might be legally blind but I am not stupid. If I was totally blind with no help my place would have been totally jacked up after the sign off. and lastly they put my upper kitchen cabinets in crooked.They had to pull and put in correctly... who does not use a level when putting in cabinets. name: Kent Schroeder
text:
We had a problem with mold forming along out dining room baseboards. Paul Davis Restoration was recommended to remove the moldy materials and repair the walls. Two groups of folks with different skills and equipment were needed to effect the repair.

Phase 1: Dan Wong came to the house and took pictures and measurements and provided a detailed estimate for removing the mold. Work was scheduled soon after and workers removed the affected materials within a couple of hours and left a very large dehumidifier, four or five air handlers and a couple of HEPA filter units. After three days of continuous noise and tripped circuit breakers the walls were dried out, my allergies started clearing up and I was a happy camper.

Phase 2: Dustin Hunt came to the house to survey the "damage" take measurements and pictures, then provided a detailed estimate for reconstruction of the dining room walls. Work was scheduled soon after and workers arrived at the scheduled time and completed the work over 2.5 days since drywall and paint take longer. Now our dining room is as good as new and most important of all the wife is happy.

name: Billy Jordan
text: Servpro was awesome. Came out quickly and got our crawl space dried within hours. Recommend them to anybody who needs something done right.

name: Heather McCormick
text:
Do not use this company whatever you do. I had my  rental house flood and it was the worst experience of my life using Serve Pro of Tuscaloosa.I had to call them 3-5 times to even go to the house to get the clean up  process started.Kept being told they was going out to start and when contractors went to give me estimates on repairs there would be no one at the house working on the clean up.They have lied to me several times about my property.Told me several different start and finish dates.They left drying fans in my house 7 days running after they had already cut the drywall and  insulation out. Drew one of the sales guys made up stories about the situation, told my tenant I had told him things when I hadn't even talked to the guy yet and told two different things ones to me and my tenant .I asked Drew why he did this and let him know I would be calling the office and  he proceeded to call my tenant a couple of times and send me a  6 page text over the situation which I found very unprofessional . When I called to complain about this Jacob the owners son took  up for the actions, was rude to me, did not listen to me and acted like I was bothering him.I was told my cabinets needed replaced when they did not. They pulled the vanity out of my master bathroom that did not need pulled out to begin with  without cutting the caulk and when they pulled the vanity it caused the mirror in the bathroom to fall on the sink shattering my mirror and busting my sink in the bathroom and tried to blame it on the heat in the room.I called  David the head of the construction department several times asking a start date and was told no repairs would be started  until they had 18 thousand upfront, Half the cost, and to ask my adjuster to call  his cooperate office and have Fed Ex deliver it to them.I asked my adjuster about it and he said that they did not that money upfront and was beyond shocked I had been told that.They still have their little lock box on my door a week after I told them I will not be using their services anymore, I have called four times to ask to have removed.I have called and asked  three times to speak to the owner of the franchise and got no response. The office staff is not friendly, they have horrible attitudes and make you feel  brushed off.  Brandy the girl in the office is very rude and  blows me off and acts like I'm a bother to her when I call to ask to speak to a manager or owner  . This is the most unprofessional company I have ever came into contact with in my life. And I strongly suggest people think  twice before using them for any reason. You will regret it if you  use this company, trust me on that.They thought since it was an insurance claim they would  take me for a run and rob me and  my insurance company blind and have caused me nothing  but a headache and  added stress from what happened to my home.

Chelsea
don't know how to reply to you  but this way. I too have a  job. Cant answer my phone if I'm busy.I have been trying to contact the owner since June 1st regarding all my issues when they first began.Have called several times .Today is June 20 and first attempt to be reached out to by the owner. You need  new office staff and employees that don't lie to customers and be extremely rude to them. I want my sink and my mirror replaced that was broken courtesy of your employees negligence. Thank you.

resp.text: Good morning Heather, I am deeply sorry you have not had a good experience talking with our staff. I have notified the owner, when we received your yelp review also. It looks like he tried to call about 9:00 am this morning. Please feel free to reach out at any time or email us at servpro8822@servprooftuscaloosa.com. The office has been directed to patch you through to him direct, if he is in during our office hours 8am-5:00 pm. I will follow up with him this afternoon to try and reach you again. I apologize for your less than ideal customer experience during this event in your home. The owner and I would be happy to work with you to figure out where communication errors started and how we can correct them in the future.  - Chelsea

name: Tammy
text:
They were all very sweet and helpful when they came out to our house for a house fire. But then everything got very confusing. We didn't know what was going to happen or when. Then they came in and packed all of our things up, first our clothes and no one told us to keep out any clothes. So we had no clothes blankets or pillows by the time they finished. There was 2 rooms that just had to be cleaned but they threw out our beds and furniture and took out all the carpet. We put notes on two closets and put don't enter.. I found the notes in the floor when we returned. They packed up everything and took it with them but nothing was cleaned it was just in the box they had packed it in.
They told us they we're going to clean the duck work, it was not cleaned, the ceiling fans were not cleaned nor were the blinds. We have had to just  about replace everything  we own plus we had use or own  money to eat at the hotel for   for over 2 months. Being nice is great but we had to many people telling us different things..it took a month after we got to come home before they started bring things back. It made difficult to cook. We had to buy new pots just fry an egg.
When they finally brought things back they were very confused about everything because the young guy and 3 woman that packed us up were fired. They didn't seem to know what was ours and what wasn't.  There are quite a few things missing.  Some of the items are antique and can't be replaced.  The thing is these items problem  went to someone else  and they just saw it was old and not there's. Maybe I need to go check the thrift store.  I didn't think this was going to be easy but this has been a nightmare. I have items that have tags on them, but they didn't take them or clean them. My blinds still have soot on them and it is not easy to clean. They we're supposed to clean and check or duct work , not even touched. And we saw the check our insurance sent them and that was way too much for this mess. This is the first time in 15 years we have made a claim on our house or auto  and now State Farm will not cover our house anymore. So we are going to have to sale our house and move because this put us in the red.

resp.text:
Tammy, I am so sorry for your bad experience with our crews. This is the first we have heard of any issue with your loss. We are trying to look into it internally, but would love for you to call the office at 553-8377 and let us know more so that we can get this issue resolved and make sure everything met to your satisfaction. - Chelsea

Tammy, Thank you for editing your review so that we may have a little insight on why you are unhappy with SERVPRO. I would like to also thank you for your kind words on our crews being "sweet and helpful." I can address that clothing and other textiles were cleaned by another company and not by SERVPRO of Tuscaloosa. We would like you to reach out to our General Manager and Owner at 205-553-8377 when you are comfortable and allow us to address and mend your concerns that we do have control over. Any issues between the claim and your insurance provider will have to be handled through their customer service, as our company does not have direct correlation between your insurance coverage. Again, we are sorry for the headache that was truly in control of our Franchise and the General Manager/Owner would, again, invite you to call and see how we can clear up confusion and give us the opportunity to fix what we are able to.

name: Christina Graham
text:
Please consider this review a PSA! Do NOT use this place. Perhaps if you are a corporate client, they will do well on your job. If you are individual customer, they likely will perform extremely poorly.

I was lied to on a couple of different occasions with my job, in particular about them contacting my insurance and the times that they did so. They typically arrived late (45 min to 1 hour) or on one occasion, they were so late that I was told to not even bother waiting. This was actually after being told by the person managing my job (supposedly managing it) that he thought they were finished up at my place. NOPE! Even after officially signing off that they were done, I brought in another mitigation company...and they are currently finishing the job that ServPro was hired to do.

There are major breaks in communication internally, as well as externally. I wouldn't recommend this company to my worst enemy. Please don't use them and keep them in business any longer.

resp.text: Christina, this is deeply disturbing news to read. We did not know you had any concerns during your experience with SERVPRO of Tuscaloosa. Our office deeply apologizes for your additional distress in your experience with our crews. Residential claims are very important to us as well and we strive to do our best whether we are in a residential home or commercial business. We are very sorry you feel you did not receive our best. Our owners and management are actively investigating your claim file and you will hear from us directly with more questions and information soon. We want to make sure you are taken care of properly and wish that we had known throughout the job process that you were unhappy with the crew in your home.

name: Wes Graff
text: These people are basically crooks. I had an incident with a customer involving a drain line that leaked into the floor overnight and made a mess. I went out to see the damage myself before we called servpro out to clean it up. It was very minimal water on the floor. The only reason I didn't clean it up myself is because I didn't have a shop vac on my truck and thought it shouldn't cost more than a few hundred dollars to get it cleaned up, even though it was on the weekend, because there just honestly was very little that needed to be done. I was wrong. They charged me over a thousand dollars to do almost nothing besides vacuum up a small amount of water. Then on top of that they left their water bucket in the hallway over the weekend. It leaked water into the stairwell and ruined some of my clients ceiling tiles. When confronted about this Servpro management said that their bucket doesn't leak and that they were not going to replace the tiles. Please do not contact Servpro, they will take advantage of you on every turn.

text: Professional Staff!  Very helpful and knowledgeable.

name: amy bentley
text: Can't say enough about the professionalism and service we received from ServPro in Tuscaloosa. Would highly recommend!

name: Thomas Billups
text:
My experience with Servpro of Tuscaloosa has been a nightmare for me and my family.
My 84 years old mother who suffers from Parkinson has been hurt more by Servpro of Tuscaloosa than by the tornado that damaged her home earlier in the year.
My parents used Servpro to store furniture and electronics in order to cleanup and rebuild after the tornado. Furniture stored with Servpro was returned broken, damaged and electronic items like televisions and a crystal chandelier are missing. Six months after they were paid by the insurance company and four months after returning the damaged items Servpro owner Don Elmore has yet to make things right. They are so eager to drum up new customers that they don’t service their current customers. Their customer service stinks.

name: J.R. Cunningham
text:
Worst experience of a lifetime. Lost valuable jewelry, broke a tv, scarred furniture. I asked for them to pay for the things. The answer from Kevin Driggers was, "Mr. Cunningham don't wait for a check from us, if we paid every complaint we'd go broke."
That is about the only true statement I heard from ServPro. They are not members of BBB.
The owner Don Elmore's final word to me were, "just sue me, sue me, I have insurance, sue me."
In my opinion I would never again allow my insurance  company to employ this business, nor could I recommend anything good about them.

To top it off they even rented the pods and removed and replaced the furniture after new hardwood was installed.
We are happy to recommend Rick-N-Ball Restoration.  They are a competent, professional, courteous, dependable, timely and very customer oriented company.  Should we have restoration requirements in the future, God forbid.  would we call them again?  Absolutely and positively yes, they do everything, no worries at all.

Kevin Ball

We were very well pleased with their work and would highly recommend Rick-n-Ball to anyone that needs this type of work done in their home.  Give Rick-n-Ball a call.  You will not be disappointed.

name: Gregory Shaw
text: As a veteran, I try to utilize locally owned / operated veteran businesses whenever possible.  My first dealing with Rick-N-Ball Restoration + Construction, Inc. was in October 2019 when they modified my back patio.  The work included designing and constructing an outdoor fireplace, building a roof over the entire patio and covering it with metal panels.  Their work was outstanding and completed on schedule.  My second experience was definitely unplanned and occurred after the main water line into my home started leaking.  Upon detection I immediately contacted Rick-N-Ball for assistance / guidance as I knew they worked closely with USAA and other insurance companies to mitigate water damage and reconstruct accordingly.  Shortly after contacting them Andrew arrived with a plumber and the source of this leak was quickly detected and repaired.  Kevin then guided me through the steps necessary to initiate a claim and continues to work with USAA on my behalf.  Their professionalism and genuine concern for the homeowner’s worries made this ordeal a little more bearable.  Rick-N-Ball has completed restoration and I cannot even tell there was a leak to begin with.  I strongly recommend you contact the folks at Rick-N-Ball Restoration + Construction Inc. for any planned upgrades and / or unexpected home emergencies due to fire, wind or water damages.

I think you and Amy did a wonderful job on the stone selection for the fireplace and the red metal roof looks fantastic. Also was glad we could help with the minor water damage. Had you not found it, the damage could have gotten a lot worse. Glad we were able to keep it to a small area in the home for you. Thanks again!

text: Kevin is honest and professional. Very knowledgeable and professional team.

text: The Serv Pro crew did an excellent job. They were professional and very courteous. Arrived on time and cleaned up when they finished. The entire experience was very good. I highly recommend them to anyone needing this type of service.

name: Dominique Vickers
text: Ms. Jennie is hands down the best! She walks you through every inch of the process to make sure you have a complete understanding. Very professional and hands on! Highly recommend!

name: Mark Strong
text: Let me start by saying that this is the first time IN MY LIFE that I’ve written a bad review about a business, so the fact I feel strongly enough about this matter to do so should say enough in and of itself. Based off my family’s (ongoing) experience to-date with Servpro of Montgomery, I cannot and would not recommend this business to anyone. Mr./Mrs. Brooks, I kindly ask that you or someone in charge reach out to me in a timely manner.  As a courtesy and to give you a chance to address the issue, I will refrain from posting detailed information of surrounding incidents and the lack of professionalism and timeliness your company has exhibited thus far.  If I do not hear from anyone in a timely manner I will have to share my story in order to help future people hopefully never have to deal with the same issue(s).

resp.text:
Hi, Mark, I am the General Manager, and I am terribly sorry to hear about your family’s experience. We try to maintain the highest standards of service, but clearly that is not what happened here. Please call me at 334-284-1612 at your convenience. I'd like to know what I can do to make things right. If you need anything else please let me know.

Thank you,
Kerry Brooks

name: Lashanda Gaines
text: The entire staff was helpful. There wasn’t a doubt that I wouldn’t be taken care of. They were swift, efficient and thorough during this time.

name: Linda Ross
text: The Servpro representatives worked tirelessly to locate all the water damage and begin the drying out process.  They were professional and friendly, always answering my questions explaining each step as they were worked.  I highly recommend them!

name: Kelsea Garrett
text:
I’m at a loss for words as I write this review, but am hopeful that what happened to our family doesn't happen to someone else.

My grandmother had a horrible fall that was devastating to her life. My  Dad trying to do everything he could in that moment to comfort family took a beautiful handmade silk pastel Turkish area rug to have cleaned.

With loss of family in that moment you don't think clearly especially when it's unexpected.  The rug was dropped off; there was no proof of receipt provided at the time.

The rug is no where to be found and because there was no receipt provided no proof we were told nothing can be done.

Being the price of the rug and sentimental value alone we hired an attorney to contact the store owner, and unfortunately were told there was no proof.

I hope nobody else ever has to have the same experience. Please be sure if dropping off a high ticket item regardless of the emotional state you may be in to get an exchange of a paper trail, the employee’s name, and would even add to take pictures. Beyond disappointed in how the owners have handeled this situation with no effort at all to make any attempt for a resolution.

resp.text: SERVPRO® of Montgomery is sorry to hear of the traumatic experience you and your family have suffered. Knowing what you have been through, it saddens us to know that you feel we have mishandled one of your family heirlooms. As stated in your review, there is no paperwork showing it was delivered to us for cleaning. We value our customers and enforce stringent protocols and procedures for any items entrusted to us. This helps to avoid any confusion or loss. I would like to personally investigate this matter but will need additional information to do so. Please contact our office at 334-284-1612 and ask for Kerry Brooks.

name: Cassie Spears
text: Wish I could give y'all 10 stars!! SUPER prompt, SUPER professional, efficient, effective, and just all around amazing! Ms. Jennie in the office, you have my sincerest thanks! Y'all dispatched an incredible team! God forbid I ever have to have a COVID cleaning again, but if I do, I know who to call!!

text: Very great company to hire !!!!!! They were clean and very professional during the whole process!!! Best you can get !!!

name: Dean S
text:

ServPro is an expert cleaning service and the cost of duct cleaning is very reasonable.The technicians, Lamont and Shine showed up promptly at 9AM as scheduled and completed the cleaning in about 4 hours.
Now, the dust on the grilles is gone and air quality has improved. We are very pleased with this firm.Their technicians are thorough and professional.

name: Thomas Gaughran

text: The adjuster was very prompt coming to see damage. I was pleased and look forward to hearing start date.

name: Judy Van Luchene
text:
Several days after the house was empty, we stopped to see the progress...nothing.  For two weeks, we checked every
day, no workmen.  We were assured we would be back in by Christmas.  We went through three Project Managers, and
three different set of drywall and painters.  The first painting crew stood on my washer and dryer to paint the
ceiling in the laundry leaving dents and scratches.  We had stored the liquor from our bar in tubs in the garage,
as Servpro would not remove alcohol from the home.  Apparently the painters had found it and consumed a great deal
before they were removed from the job by Darin Ingle.  They also got paint all over our floors so Servpro brought
in commercial scrubbers which removed the finish on all of our floors.

To shorten this story, I will cut to the return home.  We finally returned to our home in early March with work still
going on, Painting and damaged floors. The first night home the water under the sink of my brand new cabinets
flooded the kitchen.  They had to send in dryers and a plumber who said it was not hooked up correctly and
reworked all of the kitchen dishwasher and sink plumbing. They sent in a professional flooring company  to assess
the floors. Their solution required us to move back into a hotel for at least a week so they could clean, reseal
the tile and recolor the grout.

The only thing that saved this project was Darin Ingle who arrived on the project in February.  Darin was sent in from another state to resolve the
problems at the Montgomery location that included our home.  Darin took the reins, brought in new crews and came
every day to ensure the work got back on track and that it was done correctly.  Darin's arrival was months into
the project and while we have never sued anyone, we were on the verge of doing just that to get another company
to come in so we could go home.  I am not sure if Servpro's executives realize that Darin not only saved our project,
saved them from a lawsuit but did an amazing job saving their reputation.  I would only call them again if Darin Ingle handled the job.
Because of Darin, I am giving Servpro a 2 star rating and Darin a 5.

An update to my review.  I was contacted by Mr. Bowen, an owner.  Mr. Bowen was determined to do something to do something for All we had been through.  He offered to send in a crew or something.  While his offer was appreciated, we had already fixed many of the issues and did not feel we could ensure another work crew I agreed to think it over and get back with him.  The one thing, as I explained to him, that distressed me everytime I went into the laundry was the dents and scratches on the tops of the washer and dryer which he eagerly agreed to replace.  With much of manufacturing shut down for long periods, appliances are in short supply.  However, Mr. Bowen and Darin Ingle were able to replace order And have new ones installed.  My frustration is no longer renewed when I walk into my laundry room.  My thanks to Mr. Bowen for reaching out and making this a better experience, and to Darin Ingle for making it happen.  It is good to know they cared to make things better.

resp.text:
Hi Judy, I am one of the owners and I am terribly sorry to hear about your experience. We try to maintain the highest standards of service, but clearly that is not what happened here. Please call me at 334-284-1612 at your convenience. I'd like to know what I can do to make things right. If you need anything else please let me know.

Thank you,
Bruce Bowen

name: Nicki Harper
text: We suffered surface water intrusion which resulted in thousands of dollars worth of damage to our home and personal effects. The night of the flood a representative from Restoration 1of Birmingham took our call, we explained the situation and 8 am the next morning a full crew arrived ready to work. We are so grateful for the crew in charge of our clean up including Jeff H, John, Scott, Jacob, Jeff D and Derek. and several others who worked tirelessly removing water soaked area rugs, hardwoods, baseboards and trim molding so that we could begin the process of restoration. Even neighbors commented on the dogged efforts they made to rid our home of damaged items. Flooding is a headache to deal with but if and when it happens, these are the people who take it seriously. They have the crews to complete the process, they are truly professional yet personal enough to listen to your concerns. I’d give six stars if it were an option.

name: Colby Duckett
text:
I used rainbow international to help with a moisture condensation issue in my crawlspace that caused some water damage to the floor as well as some mold growth in the crawl space. They were very responsive and professional throughout the inspection, estimate, and remediation process.

They gave me appropriate information to help me determine what option was the best quality and value for my specific situation.

They performed a mold remediation treatment, installed a dehumidifier in the crawl space, replaced the crawl space door, and sealed the crawl space vents with cover that I provided, and all for a very reasonable price.

I would certainly use Rainbow International again for a situation similar to this one, and I would recommend their serviced to others in this situation as well.

resp.text: Thank you so much Mr Duckett! While we hope you don’t Need our services again, we’re Always Here for any Water,Fire, or Mold disasters anyone may have.

name: Heather Thomas
text: This company came to dry up water damage. The young men were kind, respectful, & wonderful at their job! Not only did they pay attention to detail, they were very calming during a very emotional process. I would recommend them to anyone!

name: madyson cotton
text: The service was excellent and involved the removal of flooring and set of equipment to dry  wet plywood in three rooms. I was very pleased with them and the services performed. Thank you so much to Matt, Tre and Luke.

text: It was a great experience with Rainbow during a crazy day.  We had a pipe burst and flood our home.  Matt was there as soon as he could be. Matt made sure everything was dry to the point of no mold or mildew before he was finished. He was very professional and personable throughout the situation, even though we were a little crazy. Thank you Matt and Rainbow International for helping us through these past few crazy days and helping us get life back to normal.

text: Initially, I would have given them a higher rating.  However, I had the carpet cleaned for 3 bedrooms and 7 steps for $150. The boy was very polite. They looked really good when he got done. He seemed to be in a hurry. He didn't move any furniture. Now, we are 2 months out and all of the carpet stains are now back. I have someone else coming next week to clean them again. I wouldn't waste my money.

resp.text: We regret that you are not fully satisfied. You may be experiencing something known as "wicking". We would be happy to clean those spots again if you choose. And we do offer other packages that include moving the furniture in rooms. Just let us know if you would like us to clean these spots again.

name: steve puckett
text: I would like to thank Blake and his entire team.  In the mist of the Pandemic Crisis, our washer and kitchen sink overflowed and flooded a large area of our home. Blake and team arrived at my home the very next day. They worked as a team and set about examining the situation.  They were careful to inform me and my wife of each situation and problem found. They worked to remove damaged cabinets, flooring, and drywall.  Blake painstakingly worked to remove cabinets and countertops without more damage to each of the items.  Over the next several days, Blake continued to check on our situation and closely monitored how our situation was improving.  He amazed me not only with his efficient clean-up but with his knowledge about what was needed. Blake was especially helpful in explaining what had happened and the steps they were taking. He is very helpful and conscientious. Thank you for sending such a dedicated individual (Blake) and a great team that supports him.  It was awesome to see such compatibility in the mist of our crisis.
